result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micheal L Marschner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8:34 Defendant Micheal L Marschner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Defendant Micheal L Marschner in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed and read-in to 14CF240.

10:36 Defendant Micheal L Marschner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Defendant Micheal L Marschner in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing and enters plea of not guilty. Attorney Slattery requests bond be amended to signature bond. State objects. Court denies motion to modify bond. Bond is continued.
Plea hearing on September 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
No contact with A.C. or residence or M.K.C. DOB 1-11-12 or any child.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
No contact with A.C., M.K.C. or any children of A.C. or their residence.

Defendant Micheal L Marschner in court with attorney Jessica Anne Shank by special appearance.  Defendant Micheal L Marschner in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bound over for preliminary hearing.
